     like when i make multiple different types of content, and different people like each different type, and everyone's mad at me for not doing only their favorite

6.4.17  7:38 pm   The internet has definitely changed how people find and listen to music, as well as how many bands/artists release or present their music... But do you think that its led to changes in the music itself (kind of like how radio changed how many pop songs were written, formatted and produced back in the day)?

     i think most of those changes have probably not really set in yet

     the atmosphere

I feel like I'd get a lot done while also feeling a sense of companionship.

     ah, that seems reasonable

     they would blend together too much that way. but i am considering setting up something with next and previous buttons

6.4.17  10:14 am   why did you do jazz covers during the production of hotewig? I remember you saying that you only did them if there was nothing else to do.

6.4.17  9:50 am   How did you figure out your art style?

6.4.17  9:07 am   Do you get upset that people ask the same questions over and over?

6.4.17  9:03 am   in "a Play featuring an iphone power block and a mechanical pencil" you used a capital letter in the video title but not in the video itself. you also capitalized "February" (correct) and "Shitty" (wrong). what is the explanation?

     a phone charger and a pencil are talking to each other about calendars, and the capitalization scheme is what you think most needs an explanation?

6.4.17  7:56 am   Will you make a video for your new song? pls

     how about i make more songs instead

6.4.17  7:34 am   whats your song-picking system?

     i'm randomizing from a long list of songs which includes songs where the writing is finished and where writing is not finished. whichever one i pick, i have to finish the writing, and record it. this is a system i started to use last year except this year i have added an extra twist which is that i tell myself that i technically don't have to release it, but i do have to finish it and record it. this is very important because it prevents me from getting cold feet about the selection, and helps me carry on and record it and not 'blame the selection.' this creates somewhat of a paradox because if i follow through on the recording, i'm gonna find a way to make it good, and will end up posting it in the end. but for some reason it really helps to at least pretend thst i'm not required to release it. this enables me to freely experiment on trying to make the best of what might seem like a weak selection. for example, when 'california' came up, my first reaction was 'oh no, not another weed song. people are gonna think all my songs are about weed' and i probably would have chickened out on the selection and then the entire credibility of the random system would collapse. but if i'm allowed to just 'try' recording it to see if i can make it good, it removes the pressure. and allows me to try making it the best i can make it, without stressing that it's the wrong selection. like i said, this strategy is a huge paradox in many ways but it seems to work

6.4.17  6:53 am   If I intend to be funny by intentionally doing something unfunny does it become funny or does the meta circle find it's way back to not funny?

     nothing is funny

6.4.17  6:25 am   I don't think culture can be appropriated, people don't do things just because its their culture, they do it because they like it or someone told them they should. I guess you could do something from a different culture to make fun of it, but that's just mocking not 'appropriating'. what do you think about cultural appropriation?

     some days u gotta just appropriate the shit out of some culture

6.3.17  11:31 pm   this answer will determine the rest of my life: should I leave my degree and start studying to become a professional guitar player? anyway any answer will determine the rest of my life, even no answer at all, so feel free to answer just saying lettuce. also I love your content

     to become a professional guitar player, studying will not help you get gigs. but getting gigs will make you a better guitar player, and it will also lead you to more gigs. and if you're getting better then you might be able to keep better gigs. i'm not sure if thst answers your question

6.3.17  8:47 pm   If somebody was born and raised in a cave, in complete isolation from all society and technology since birth, but in their cave there was a grand piano (that they've had since birth)... Do you think that person would have an inclination to play and make music (in some form) on that piano without any knowledge of the existence or even the concept of music? Or would they just think "this thing makes strange noises when I hit these little black and white rectangles... that's weird" and that would be the end of it?

     having a piano in your living space is one of the best and easiest ways to understand music
